article:
'Fuller' is a surname referring to someone who treats wool with the process
called Fulling (a process also known as walking—or waulking in
Scotland—and tucking, hence the names Walker and Tucker) and may refer to:

*Alexandra Fuller, British writer *Alfred Fuller (1885â1973), Canadian
businessman *Allen Curtis Fuller (1822â1901), Attorney General of Illinois
during the American Civil War *Alvan T. Fuller (1878â1958), U.S. politician from
Massachusetts *Andrew Fuller, British Baptist minister *Andrew Fuller
(entomologist) (1828â1896), American entomologist *Barry Fuller, English footballer *Ben
Hebard Fuller (1870â1937), U.S. Marine Corps general *Blind Boy Fuller, stage
name of U.S. blues singer and guitarist Fulton Allen *Bobby Fuller (1942â1966),
U.S. rock singer and guitarist *Brad Fuller, Australian rules footballer *Bryan
Fuller, American screenwriter *Buckminster Fuller (1895â1983), U.S. architect
*Calvin Fuller (1902â1994), U.S. physical chemist, inventor of the solar cell
*Charles Fuller (born 1939), U.S. playwright *Charles Edward Fuller (1887â1968),
U.S. preacher and founder of Fuller Theological Seminary *Charles Eugene Fuller
(1849â1926), U.S. congressman *Charles Fuller (Carolina) (1832â1901) (middle
